subject: Nutrition
title: The Baby Food Diet
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Baby Food Diet.

hook.text: In 2010, celebrities replaced meals with jars of baby foodâ€”pureed carrots for dinner.

buildup.text: The diet promised portion control with 14 jars of baby food daily plus one regular adult meal.

discovery.text: Baby food is designed for infants. Adults need higher protein, fiber, and calorie density to function.

twist.text: Long-term use causes nutrient deficiencies because baby food lacks adult nutritional requirements.

climax.text: The baby food diet shows how desperate people become for quick fixesâ€”even eating food meant for infants.

punchline.text: Adults eating baby food was peak diet culture absurdity.

quiz.question: Why is baby food inadequate for adults?
options: Lacks adult protein and fiber needs
